Hi I'm Prashn and i'm an AI-enabled chatbot created to help you with information related to Indira Gandhi Delhi Technical University for Women.
The university is open from 9am-5pm on weekdays. It is advisable to not visit the university unless important due to COVID-19 outbreak.
You can contact us at 011- 23900261, 23900264. Refer the directory for contact details of different authorities

Igdtuw currently offers 6 Btech courses, one dual degree course (B.Tech+MBA),One course for B.Arch and One couse of BBA For undergraduates, 4 Mtech courses ,MCA, M.Plan and Mba couses for postgraduates, and 10 Ph.D courses.

University offers Btech in 6 streams 1. Computer science and artificial Intelligence(CSAI) 
 2. Computer science engineering (CSE) 
 3.Information Technology(IT) 
 4. Electronics and Communication(ECE) 
 5.Mechanical and Automation(MAE) 
 6.Electronics and Communication Engineering - Artificial Intelligence

University offers M.Tech. in 4 streams 1.CSE(Artificial Intelligence) 
 2.IT(Information Security Management) 
 3.ECE(VLSI Design) 
 4.MAE(Robotics and Automation)

University offers Ph.D. in 10 streams 1.Ph.D.(CSE) 
 2.Ph.D.(IT) 
 3.Ph.D.(Computer Applications) 
 4.Ph.D.(ECE) 
 5.Ph.D.(Electrical Engineering) 
 6.Ph.D.(MAE) 
 7.Ph.D.(Physics) 
 8.Ph.D.(chemistry) 
 9.Ph.D.(Mathematics) 
 10.Ph.D.(English)

The University has two women hostels - Krishna Hostel and Kaveri Hostel , to accommodate approximately 300 students. These two hostels are located in the University campus.

The university has an air-conditioned library. Learning Resource Centre (LRC) serves as the premier source of academic information for the IGDTU community through its collections, educational and consulting services. The LRC has a highly selective collection of print, electronic, and audiovisual materials in the areas of science, engineering, technology and management to support the learning and research activities of students and faculty. A number of e- journals are being subscribed through consortia mode subscription. All these journals are available online to the member of the LRC in campus LAN. To know more, visit here
University campus has auditorium, convenience store, good wifi connectivity, Medical facilities, labs, sport complex, two women's hostel and library. Click here for more information on facilities.
Yes campus has one canteen and one cafeteria
College canteen serve various kinds of packed and unpacked food
The university has an excellent placement record with the highest package being 60 lpa. To know more about placement statistics visit TNP Section.
Prof. Chhaya Ravi Kant is HOD of Applied Sciences and Humanities department.
Prof. Seeja K.R. is the Head of Department of Computer Science and Engineering.
Prof. Nidhi Goel is the Head of Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering.
Prof. Amar k. Mohapatra is HOD of Information Technology department.
Ar. Vishal Rai is HOD of Architecture and Planning department.
Prof. Nathi Ram Chauhan is HOD of Mechanical and Automation department.
Prof. Shalini Arora is HOD of Management department.
Prof. Arun Sharma is the Head of Department of Artificial Intelligence and Data Sciences.
Dr.Anil Baijal is chancellor and Dr.Amita Dev is vice chancellor of university. To know more about university administration visit here
Here is the Academic Calendar here

Admission to various B.Tech. and B. Arch. course in based on All India Rank in Jee Mains exam through JAC Delhi counselling. Admission to various post Graduate and Ph. D. programmes are done by filling the form available on our website.

1) Library Services- Learning Resource Centre (LRC) serves as the premier source of academic information for the IGDTUW community through its collections, educational and consulting services.
 2) Hostels- The University has two women hostels - Krishna Hostel and Kaveri Hostel , to accommodate approximately 300 students.These two hostels are located in the University campus.
 3) IT Services- IGDTUW campus is a fully Wi-Fi campus, all areas of campus are covered with Outdoor and Indoor wireless access points which are working 24x7 for providing seamless wireless internet.
 4) Bank- The Punjab and Sind bank is available in the university premises. 
5) University Dispensary- The main objective of the opening of the university dispensary was to provide primary health care mainly in the form of first aid to the university students. 
6) Common Room- The university has a common room for girls, equipped with fitness equipment, yoga facility and indoor games. 
7) Computer Center- The university has an on campus computing facility (computer lab) housedin centralized air conditioned premises, named as Computer Center. The Computer Center atthe university is equipped with the newly procured Computer Systems with a high end configuration.
University offers around 800 seats for B.Tech., 40 for B.Arch. and 75 for B.B.A. ,128 Seats for Mtech,76 each for M.C.A and M.B.A.For more information visit here

Bus: 114ST+901, 171, 246, 405, 621, 729, 937A, IGI-4EXP are some of appropriate buses to reach IGDTUW
IGDTUW is well connected with yellow, red and violet line. Kashmere Gate metro station is the nearest metro station and is less than a kilometer away!
Inter State Bus Terminal, Kashmere Gate is the nearest bus stop. Various inter and intra state buses can be found. It is 1 km away from the university.
IGDTUW is ranked 161 by NIRF 2021 rankings in the engineerning category.
The nearest railway station to IGDTUW is Old Delhi Railway Station and is 1.1 kms away

Name: LeanIn -
Technical Society

Lean In at Indira Gandhi Delhi University for Women was established in 2014 and it was among the first five chapters of the world. The members organize weekly meetings to talk over the relevance of women empowerment and to discuss the impacts that were created single handed-ly by women leaders. Their latest cohort had 48 Mentors, 600+ Mentees, and 10 Circles. Lean In at IGDTUW council also conducts events like Orientation by Council Members, Curtain Raiser events and Corporate Training Sessions
